columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to determine the effective annual interest rate and amount of interest.

## Requirement a
**Effective Cost of Borrowing** or also known as effective interest rate is the rate of interest that a borrower actually pays on a loan.

Effective Cost of Borrowing is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \dfrac{[\text{$(1 + i)^m$}]-1}{\text{1 - n}}\\
\end{aligned}$$


Where:

EAR - Effective Annual Interest Rate

*i* - Monthly Interest Rate

*m* - Number of months

*n* - Investment in Non-interest Bearing

Let's identify the given figures in the problem.

| | | 
|--|--:| 
|Monthly Interest Rate |0.36% | 
| Investment in Non-interest Bearing|4% |

We can now compute the effective annual interest rate using the equation in step 3.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \dfrac{[\text{$(1 + i)^m$}]-1}{\text{1 - n}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{[\text{$(1 +0.36\%)^{12}$}]-1}{\text{1 - 4\%}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{[\text{$(1 .0036)^{12}$}]-1}{\text{0.96}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{[\text{$(1 .0036)^{12}$}]-1}{\text{0.96}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{1.0440}-1}{\text{0.96}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{0.0440}}{\text{0.96}}\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\textbf{4.59\%}}
\end{aligned}$$


**Therefore, the effective annual interest rate on this lending arrangement is 4.59%.**

## Requirement b

**Interest** is a charge to the borrower for the use of an asset.

To begin, let's first compute the amount to borrow by dividing the amount required by the difference between 1 and compensating balance. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Amount to Borrow} &= \dfrac{\text{Amount Required}}{\text{1 - Compensating Balance}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$13,000,000}}{\text{1 - 4\%}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$13,000,000}}{\text{0.96}}\\[10pt]
&=\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 13,541,666.67}}}
\end{aligned}$$

Next, let's compute the interest amount using the equation below:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Interest} &= \text{[Amount to borrow} \times {\text{$(1 + i)^{t}$}]}-{\text{Amount to borrow}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{[13,541,666.67} \times {\text{$(1 + 0.36\%)^{t}$}]}-{\text{13,541,666.67}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{[13,541,666.67} \times {\text{$(1.0036)^{6}$}]}-{\text{13,541,666.67}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{[13,541,666.67} \times {\text{1.0218}]}-{\text{13,541,666.67}}\\[5pt]
&= \text13,836,811.84{}-{\text{13,541,666.67}}\\[5pt]
&=\boxed{\textbf{\$ 295,145.17}}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the company will pay an interest amounting to **$295,145.17**.
